artist: Artist: Sebald Beham; Artist: After Barthel Beham

creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus

inscription:
Signature, Date, Stamp, Label

label taped to mount: Elizabeth Hamilton.Jeffrey Wortman, Inc., 401 West End Avenue, New York, NY 10024
markings: stamps of Albert W. Blum, Lugt 3198 and 79b; Elizabeth Hamilton/Jeffrey Wortman label
provenance: Albert W. Blum (1882-1952), Lugt 3198 and 79b, Switzerland and Short Hills, N.J. [Elizabeth Hamilton/Jeffrey Wortman, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, lower right: [1544 / HSB]
text: German artisans relied on ornamental prints to decorate everything from candlesticks to beer steins. These winged putti, struggling with armor that’s sprouting stems, ended up on a fancy iron trunk lock preserved in Vienna’s Kunsthistorisches Museum.
title: Ornament with Cuirass and Two Genii, From Four Ornaments, Plate 4
